name: omnisciently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is omniscient (= having or seeming to have unlimited knowledge): She believed that God omnisciently watched all her actions and thoughts. This story is narrated omnisciently so that we hear the thoughts of both of the main characters.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's just not possible for investors to be omnisciently rational, because the relationship between risk and return is not constant.She smiled back at me omnisciently and said, "That's not entirely accurate, is it?"The narrator tells the story omnisciently, commenting on all the characters and their actions.
